p: As illustrated in Figure 3, samples containing M. communis represented a decrease in AV by a significant difference, as compared to the control; however, samples containing T. carmanicus, BHA, or TBHQ showed a decrease in AV by no significant difference. As shown in Figure 3, the samples containing M. communis and control samples had the highest increasing slope of acidity and TBHQ had the lowest slope. The results obtained by Allam and El‐Sayed ( 2004) showed that fried potato chips in the oil containing vitamins A and C had a lower AV value during the frying period, as compared to the control.
